body:
Most probably disk IO takes that overhead time.

Do you have YII_DEBUG enabled?
Did you try to create a `/dev/null` handler for `yii\db\Command::execute` message category?

No it's only about the call to `getRawSql()`. I don't even have a log target for db.

You can see in stats above, 2.370 seconds are spend within `getRawSql()` itself, the rest (~6.4 seconds) are spend in the methods it's calling.

Method `Command::getRawSql()` may cause a perfromance impact  since it parses parameters in the SQL and replaces it with thier values. These string processing may take significant time to be performed.
However, it is still unlikely it will take several seconds to do so.

In your timeline it seems the method `Connection::getSlavePdo()` causes the time consumption.
It is used inside `Schema::quoteValue()`, which is used at `Command::getRawSql()`.

I have looked at `getSlavePdo()` before and noticed nothing unusual in the way it works. It's expected I guess because it's called 24k times - unnecessarily in this case. Also I have no slave configured.

> However, it is still unlikely it will take several seconds to do so.

9,000 milliseconds / 3,000 rows = 3 ms per row. These are rather large rows (causing big sql string and 3000 \* 12 params `getRawSql()` has to crunch through).
Are you able to compose standalone performance test for this matter?

issue.title: Fixed excess escaping in Command::batchInsert()

issue.body:
| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Is bugfix?    | yes
| New feature?  | no
| Breaks BC?    | no. Read bellow
| Tests pass?   | hope so :)
| Fixed issues  | #11242

Fixes #11242


There is a test that contain a comment about a potentially wrong behavior. This behavior was NOT introduced in this PR, I've just covered it with a unit test.
